item.title: Tina add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "They build their own Hells." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Tina add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Tina add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "She had no tolerance for scenes which were not of her own making." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Tina add a quote by Marisa de los Santos
item.description: "Jimmy Stewart is always and indisputably the best man in the world, unless Cary Grant should happen to show up." -- Marisa de los Santos

item.title: Tina add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "An infinite question is often destroyed by finite answers. To define everything is to annihilate much that gives us laughter and joy." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Tina add a quote by Goldie Hawn
item.description: "If we can just let go and trust that things will work out they way they're supposed to, without trying to control the outcome, then we can begin to enjoy the moment more fully. The joy of the freedom it brings becomes more pleasurable than the experience itself." -- Goldie Hawn

item.title: Tina add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Tina add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Tina add a quote by Horace Annesley Vachell
item.description: "I have been crying," she replied, simply, "and it has done me good. It helps a woman you know, just as swearing helps a man." -- Horace Annesley Vachell

item.title: Tina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Women are meant to be loved, not to be understood." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Selfishness is not living as one wishes to live, it is asking others to live as one wishes to live." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Tina add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "It's that wonderful old-fashioned idea that others come first and you come second. This was the whole ethic by which I was brought up. Others matter more than you do, so 'don't fuss, dear; get on with it'." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Tina add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description:
"I have to be alone very often. I'd be quite happy if I spent from Saturday night until Monday morning alone in my apartment. That's how I refuel."
(<i>Audrey Hepburn: Many-Sided Charmer</i>, LIFE Magazine, December 7, 1953)" -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Tina add a quote by Jill A. Davis
item.description: "Happy endings aren't for cowards." -- Jill A. Davis

item.title: Tina add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "Make up a story... For our sake and yours forget your name in the street; tell us what the world has been to you in the dark places and in the light. Don't tell us what to believe, what to fear. Show us belief's wide skirt and the stitch that unravels fear's caul." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Tina add a quote by Walter Mosley
item.description: "A peasant that reads is a prince in waiting." -- Walter Mosley

item.title: Tina add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Tina add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books..." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Tina add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Tina add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "All happiness depends on courage and work." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Tina add a quote by Hal Borland
item.description: "No winter lasts forever; no spring skips its turn." -- Hal Borland

item.title: Tina add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Tina add a quote by J.G. Ballard
item.description: "I believe in the power of the imagination to remake the world, to release the truth within us, to hold back the night, to transcend death, to charm motorways, to ingratiate ourselves with birds, to enlist the confidences of madmen." -- J.G. Ballard

item.title: Tina add a quote by Amy Hempel
item.description: "I want to know everything about you, so I tell you everything about myself." -- Amy Hempel

item.title: Tina add a quote by Eleanor Hodgman Porter
item.description: "Be glad. Be good. Be brave." -- Eleanor Hodgman Porter

item.title: Tina add a quote by Robert Penn Warren
item.description: "Tell me a story of deep delight." -- Robert Penn Warren

item.title: Tina add a quote by Clare Boothe Luce
item.description: "Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable." -- Clare Boothe Luce
